result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Eugene Gillispie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $900.00 to be paid to Tri City Bank.

DNA sample and DNA surcharge is mandatory and assessed if not already done.
Payment of any applicable surcharges, costs, fees and restitution are to be collected by the DOC from all applicable prison funds and wages, in an amount or a percentage which the Department determines is reasonable, as well as during any applicable period of Extended Sueprvision.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
-Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving seven (7) years Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victims: Joanna C. and any TriCity Bank in Milwaukee County.

Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Any other programming ordered by the department or agent.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include: those as listed.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

per order dated January 4, 2019, Appeal No. 2018XX45-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Gilllispie to file a postconviction motion or a notice of appeal is extended through March 4, 2019. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a) (2015-16).
Motion for Extension of Time to File Rule 809.30 Postconviction Motion or Notice of Appeal, received.

per order dated December 5, 2018, Appeal No. 2018XX45-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to January 2, 2019. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a) (2015-16).
Motion for Extension of Time To File Rule 809.30 Postconviction Motion Or Notice Of Appeal, received.

per order dated July 17, 2018, Appeal No. 2018XX45-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to December 3, 2018. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a) (2015-16).
Motion for Extension of Time to File Rule 809.30 Postconviction Motion or Notice of Appeal, received.

Per order dated May 3, 2018, Appeal No. 2018XX45-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Gillispie to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended until the date thirty days aftrer the supreme court resolves the later of State v. Williams, No. 2016AP883-CR, and State v. Cox, No. 2016AP1745-CR.
Motion to Stay 809.30 Postconviction Motion Deadline, received.

per order dated March 13, 2018, Appeal No. 2018XX45-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Gillispie to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended through May 8, 2018. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a) (2015-16).
Motion for Extension of Time to File Rule 809.30 Postconviction Motion or Notice of Appeal, received.

per order dated January 10, 2018, Appeal No. 2018XX45-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Gillispie to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal in this matter is extended to March 9, 2018.
Motion for Extension of Time to File Rule 809.30 Postconviction Motion or Notice of Appeal, received.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin Eugene Gillispie in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Kevin Eugene Gillispie in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 13 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 8 years with credit for 649 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Joanna C. and any TriCity Bank in Milwaukee County.  
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Any other programming ordered by the department or agent.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $900.00 to be paid to TriCity Bank.  

- DNA sample and DNA surcharge is mandatory and assessed if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Payment of any applicable surcharges, costs, fees and restitution are to be collected by the DOC from all applicable prison funds and wages, in an amount or a percentage which the Department determines is reasonable, as well as during any applicable period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment - payment must be made by the end of extended supervision.  
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 7 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Kevin Eugene Gillispie not in court, in custody.  John Theodore Chisholm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing.  Defendant is in custody in Brown County.  The Court REMANDED the defendant into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing. Defendant Kevin Eugene Gillispie in court with attorney Alexis Liggins for Mary Garvin Guimont.  John Theodore Chisholm and William Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel requests new date.    Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Eugene Gillispie in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for John Chisholm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defendant Kevin Eugene Gillispie in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  John Theodore Chisholm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties in court for bail hearing as to conditions of bail.
Defense counsel requests that defendant be allowed release and put specifics on the record with the court.  No objection by the State.
Court orders bail conditions MODIFIED as follows:
Electronic Monitoring to be MODIFIED to allow release for the following:
- Grocery shopping for a period of one hour per week - not to be conducted at the victim grocery store
- Release for attendance at Milwaukee Area Technical College (MATC) for purposes of testing
- Release for employment

These release privileges to commence immediately.
Case remains scheduled for plea hearing in Branch 26.
